intro: Hieracium melapilum, commonly known as the alpine hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils at high altitudes. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers range in color from yellow to reddish-brown. Hieracium melapilum is often found in meadows and on slopes, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
